quest.name: Duty in the Sky with Diamond
journal: The Resistance troops have received intriguing information from Werlyt.

Shortly after arriving in Porta Praetoria, you are met by M'naago, who is there on official business. She explains that the newly formed Werlyt Revolutionaries have petitioned the Ala Mhigan Resistance for aid, and that they have elected Gaius Baelsar, their former conqueror, to lead them. Though M'naago has been ordered to travel to Terncliff to meet with representatives from Werlyt, she would feel a lot less anxious about coming face-to-face with the erstwhile Black Wolf himself if you were to accompany her.

Once more, you are provided with an escort on the long journey to Terncliff. Though you have traveled this route on several occasions, it is M'naago's first visit to this remote territory, and she finds the quaint seaside town a welcome change from the arid deserts she calls home.

You and M'naago meet as planned with Gaius and the representatives of the Werlyt Revolutionaries. Once the necessary arms and supplies have been delivered, the long-awaited confrontation with the occupying imperial forces can commence. However, Severa urges Gaius to expedite heretofore unmentioned plans, prompting Gaius to speak with you in private.

According to the letter left by Allie, she has made her way to the VIIth Legion headquarters in Werlyt to rescue her brother Alfonse. Though she makes only vague hints as to how she might achieve this, Gaius is certain that she intends to claim the final Weapon for herself and overthrow Valens van Varro. Severa suggests using the full force of the Revolutionaries to march on Werlyt to save Allie and Alfonse, but Gaius is adamant that he cannot rush in unprepared and place the Revolutionaries in jeopardy. You receive an urgent communication from Valdeaulin in Werlyt, who has witnessed what appears to be an unknown Weapon going on a wild rampage and laying waste to the VIIth Legion. Gaius assumes that the pilot is most likely Allie, and he decides to leave at once for Werlyt in the hope of saving her and Alfonse.

With the help of your acquaintance Avilina, and no small amount of foresight, Cid has equipped the G-Warrior with a range of armaments designed to pursue and capture the Weapon. So profound are the changes made to the Allagan warmachina that Cid has renamed it the G-Savior. If all goes according to plan, it will live up to its new moniker.

Unlike the G-Warrior, the G-Savior requires not one but two people to operate it. As Gaius has prior experience with the similarly built Ultima Weapon, he is chosen as the main pilot, while you are placed in charge of the various offensive and defensive systems. The success of the mission will depend on your ability to coordinate your movements and master the complexities of this enormous warmachina in a short span of time.

※The Cloud Deck can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

Through your combined efforts, you and Gaius were able to quell the rampaging Diamond Weapon. The containment field designed to hold the target captive unfortunately malfunctions, sending the warmachina crashing to the ground below. If luck is on your side─or more importantly, Allie's side─the Weapon itself will have protected the pilot from the fall.

Miraculously, Allie has survived the impact, and you arrive to find her staggering free from the wreckage. Gaius requests that you take Allie to safety while he attends to unfinished business, and he calls Valens out from his hiding place for a final confrontation. Valens goads him by claiming that Alfonse has already been fused with the core of the Diamond Weapon, which only serves to steel Gaius's resolve. After a brief clash, it is Gaius who is left standing. The Diamond Weapon suddenly reactivates and takes Valens in its grasp, squeezing the very life from its creator. Alfonse has at least exacted his revenge, but his transformation is irreversible. Gaius bids his son farewell before plunging his sword into the core, putting Alfonse out of his misery.
Back in Terncliff, you meet with Severa and Valdeaulin. Though Werlyt has been liberated and the Weapon project laid to rest, Gaius's companions still have their doubts as to what the future holds.
objectives: Confront the Diamond Weapon on the Cloud Deck.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: I wasn't expecting to see you here, considering all that's been happening about Eorzea of late. Still, if you've a mind to assist us, we'd like to share the latest developments in Werlyt.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: You've come at the right time. There've been some developments in Werlyt we'd like to share with you.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: And as luck would have it, here comes the ideal person to explain the situation.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: (-???-)Thanks. I'll take it from here.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: (-???-)I'm glad to see you looking so well, Forename.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's been too long, M'naago!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's been too long, M'zhet!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Have we met?

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Yes, it certainly has! I haven't seen you around Rhalgr's Reach much lately. Anyone would think you're trying to avoid me...

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: That attention-seeking imbecile who stinks of gunpowder?

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Hmph! Of all the people to be mistaken for! Even as a joke, that stings, you know!

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Oh, just on a few dozen occasions. Perhaps you're suffering from amnesia? If so, I hear there's no better remedy than a quick smack to the head...

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: But as much as I'd love to stand around chatting, I'm afraid I've got some serious business to discuss.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Following the liberation of Terncliff, it seems the people of Werlyt also have their hearts set on freeing themselves from the grip of the Empire.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Like-minded citizens have rallied under the banner of the Werlyt Revolutionaries, and they aim to depose the VIIth Legion that currently occupies the city.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Their ranks include many former conscripts, and between them, they possess no small amount of combat experience. The only thing they lack is someone to lead them.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: After much consideration, they decided to turn to none other than Gaius Baelsar. Of course, many would balk at the thought of turning to a former enemy─and many did─but desperate times call for desperate measures.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: His reputation as a legatus speaks for itself, and as most Ala Mhigans will attest, he was a far more reasonable and pragmatic leader than his predecessor the mad king Theodoric, or his successor Zenos, for that matter.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: But most importantly, he was the one who led the invasion of Werlyt in the first place, so who better than him to take it back? After accepting their offer, he requested the delivery of additional arms and provisions from the Ala Mhigan Resistance.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: We've got our hands full dealing with the Telophoroi, as do the rest of our allies in Eorzea, but we'll do what we can.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: While my comrades see to the preparations, I've been assigned to meet with him in person.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Not that we have much to spare at present, but we'll do what we can. While my comrades see to the preparations, I've been assigned to meet with him in person.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: I was wondering...could you accompany me to Terncliff?

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Thanks, Forename! To be perfectly honest, coming face-to-face with the Black Wolf is a rather daunting prospect, even if he has supposedly turned over a new leaf. But I'm sure having you there will make a world of difference!

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: I believe you're acquainted with our escort, yes? Let him know when you're ready to get going.

dialogue.name: CONVEYOR03783
dialogue.text: Another trip to Terncliff, is it?

dialogue.name: Q9
dialogue.text: Travel to Terncliff?

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Ah...Gaius Baelsar, I presume?

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: I come bearing the Ala Mhigan Resistance's official reply to your request for aid.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I see... You have my thanks.

dialogue.name: HIGHOFFICIAL3783
dialogue.text: Does this mean we can finally make our move?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: With the assistance of the Ala Mhigans, we will soon have sufficient arms at our disposal to stand a chance at victory. But lest we forget, the VIIth Legion has been conserving its strength thus far, and we must be prepared for severe casualties should its full might be brought to bear.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER3783
dialogue.text: If our lives must be the price of freedom, we will pay it willingly.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Let me be clear. We Ala Mhigans have not forgotten that it was you who led the invasion of our homeland. The blood of our fallen loved ones is on your hands.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Even so, the people of Werlyt chose you to lead the revolution, and we will honor their decision. I only hope they will not come to regret it.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: As do I.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Should I be found unworthy of their trust, I shall submit to their judgment and whatever that may entail.

dialogue.name: HIGHOFFICIAL3783
dialogue.text: Forgive me, but might we return to the task at hand? First, I would like to discuss the transportation of supplies from Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: HIGHOFFICIAL3783
dialogue.text: This way, if you please.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Once again, I prepare to lead an army into Werlyt. The irony is not lost on me.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: It is a cruel twist of fate that these people─so desperate from years of oppression─should turn to their conqueror for salvation.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: For most of my life, I believed that only the Empire possessed the strength and wisdom to lead mankind. That only through great sacrifice could civilization hope to thrive.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: And so I led the conquest of Eorzea, forcing the doctrine of Garlemald upon the “ignorant and uncivilized.” In every territory, I sought out those with the potential for greatness, without regard for one's birth or circumstances, that they may serve the Empire.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: But there are those such as Valens who see being born Garlean a virtue in itself, one above all others. To think that a monster such as him should be granted the position of legatus and everything that entails... It makes my blood boil.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Valens brings shame upon our homeland, and makes mock of the ideals it once stood for. By my hand, he shall pay for his foul crimes.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: We are running out of time, Gaius. We have to go after her!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: There is something I would show you, but not here. Come with me.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: I know it's an important mission and all, but it's been so long since I've traveled outside of Gyr Abania, a change of scene will do me good. As long as I try not to think about Gaius Baelsar along the way, I'm sure it'll be a pleasant journey.

dialogue.name: CONVEYOR03783
dialogue.text: We'll all be praying for your safe return, although I expect you'll be perfectly fine even without divine intervention!

dialogue.name: HIGHOFFICIAL3783
dialogue.text: Many of my comrades were dead against having Gaius Baelsar of all people lead the charge, but as I always say, “If you want a job done properly, hire a professional.” After all, he's already conquered Werlyt once, so I'm certain he'll be just as successful a second time!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER3783
dialogue.text: It's been a long time coming, but finally, Werlyt will throw off the shackles of imperial rule!

dialogue.name: CONVEYOR03783
dialogue.text: On your way back to Terncliff, eh?

dialogue.name: Q11
dialogue.text: Travel to Terncliff?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: You must keep this to yourself. I do not want the soldiers to think I am being distracted by personal matters.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: This letter was found in her room.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text:
(-Allie's Letter-)Dear Father,
I am sorry for leaving without saying good-bye, but the thought of Alfonse suffering alone is more than I can bear.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: (-Allie's Letter-)For his sake, and for the freedom of Werlyt, I have decided to take matters into my own hands.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: (-Allie's Letter-)I know of a way to save them, a way to end it all. I have to seize this chance before it is too late. My mind is set. Please, do not try to stop me, Father.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text:
(-Allie's Letter-)The days we spent together were the happiest of my life, and no matter what happens, nothing can take that away from me.
With all my love,
Allie

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: She is heading for the VIIth Legion's stronghold in Werlyt. I am certain of it.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Taking matters into her own hands...

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: She must be planning to take control of one of the Weapons.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: If so, there's no time to waste! We have to mobilize our forces and save Allie and Alfonse!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I want nothing more than to save them, but I cannot ask the Werlyt Revolutionaries to risk their lives to rescue two imperial soldiers.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: In any case, if we were to rush into battle without adequate preparation, the VIIth Legion would tear our partisan army to shreds.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: And as capable a warrior as Forename is, if shehe were to charge headlong into the heart of the enemy, shehe would be overwhelmed by sheer numbers.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: But if we don't do something, Allie and Alfonse are as good as dead!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I know, Severa. And so did Allie when she wrote that letter. Returning alive was never part of her plan.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: (-Valdeaulin-)Can you hear me? I'm in Werlyt, just outside Castrum Collinum. All hells have broken loose!

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: (-Valdeaulin-)There was an enormous explosion, and through the smoke and flames, I saw what appeared to be another Weapon! At this rate, the entire─<KRRRZZZT>

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Confound it─we have lost the signal.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: This must be what Allie spoke of in her letter...a way to end it all.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Alfonse and the others were planning this from the beginning.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: To bring the Weapon project to completion and use it to free Werlyt from the Empire, even at the cost of their own lives.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: If the Revolutionaries were to hear that a Weapon has been unleashed upon the imperial headquarters, they would see it as the perfect opportunity to strike.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: If it's running amok, it may not distinguish between our allies and the imperials. A large force would draw too much attention, but the three of us should be able to get close enough without it noticing us!

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Yes, that should work!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Between us, we'll find a way to save them!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I cannot allow it. This is my burden to bear, and I shall bear it alone.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Rest assured, I have every intention of making it out alive.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: I'll have you know my record for surviving dangerous missions is impeccable. So far.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: ...Very well.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: For the time being, I will have the Revolutionaries stand by and await my signal. An opportunity to reclaim Werlyt may yet present itself, but we must first be allowed to remove the threat of this new Weapon.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Severa, have Cid ready the G-Warrior.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Understood!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Once your preparations are complete, let us reconvene outside the hangar.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Some time earlier, in the VIIth Legion's Werlyt headquarters...

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: How wonderful it is to see you again, my dear! I was beginning to think that you weren't coming back.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: In my impatience, I may have vented my frustrations on that brother of yours. I do hope you'll forgive me...

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Lord Valens, you mentioned before that the previous Weapons were merely prototypes used to gather combat data within their cores.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Yes, very good! I see you were paying attention after all!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Ruby, Sapphire, Emerald... The primals they absorbed and the data they accumulated will serve a singular purpose...

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: ...the completion of my masterpiece, the Diamond Weapon!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: But while you and your siblings were able to retrieve the necessary data from the Ruby Weapon before Gaius and his lackeys arrived...

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: ...Sapphire and Emerald were handed to the enemy on a silver platter! Those worthless curs failed to meet even my exceedingly low expectations!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: As detailed in my report, I took it upon myself to infiltrate Gaius Baelsar's band of rebels and reclaim the data.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Yes, you have done well, my dear. My engineers have already finished feeding it to the Diamond Weapon.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Then all that remains is for me to assume my role as its pilot, and for you to release my brother and the rest of our compatriots, as per our agreement.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Of course, of course! A handful of savages is a small price to pay for your remarkable talents.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Even though the Weapon project's revolutionary technology allows even an untrained pilot to fight with the skills of a veteran soldier, only the truly gifted can draw out the full potential of the synthetic auracite.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: In addition to their physical attributes and combat prowess, I require unwavering loyalty before I can even consider entrusting a candidate with one of my creations. And you...are everything I desire.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: I am honored that you regard me so highly, Lord Valens. However, in return for my continued cooperation, I wish to propose an extra condition to our arrangement.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: I request that the people of Werlyt be given full imperial citizenship and the right to self-govern.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: My, my! How very bold of you. And quite astute, at that. Yes, I could grant the people of Werlyt citizenship, if I so desired. Unfortunately, a mere legatus such as myself is in no position to simply relinquish control of imperial territory on a whim.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Come now. We both know that the Weapons are but a means to an end.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Your true intent is to march on the capital and claim it for yourself, correct?

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Once you have taken the throne, one small territory would seem a fair reward for those who played a vital role in the ascension of Emperor Valens.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Heh... Hehehehehe...

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: I say! For someone so sweet and innocent, you certainly drive a hard bargain! Very well, if it's Werlyt you want, it's yours! I'll soon have no need for this stinking backwater province anyway!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: And what about my brother?

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Ah yes, Allwick. Or was it Alfred? Whatever his name is, you needn't worry. I've made special arrangements for him.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: He'll be perfectly safe...provided you uphold your side of the agreement.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Excellent! Now, let's get you aboard the Diamond Weapon, shall we?

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Ah... One step closer to my coronation!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: This is the moment I've been waiting for!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: ...I know this isn't what Father would've wanted, but it's the only way. Please, forgive me.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text:
Initiating the synthetic auracite system. All sensors activated.
...So far, so good.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Diamond Weapon, code name “Zenos.” Commencing activation sequence.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Behold perfection itself!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Milisandia, Ricon, and Rex gave their lives...

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: ...that others may live without fear!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Nnngh... The auracite is taking hold...

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: I'm just glad that you didn't have to go through this, Alfonse... But you'll have to go on without me. You and Father still must work together to─ Aaagh!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: ...I'm sorry I can't be there at your side. This is...the only way!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: What's that, my dear? Is something the matter?

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: The Diamond Weapon is mine! Your tyranny ends here, Valens!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Lowborn filth! If you think your little performance had me fooled, you are sorely mistaken!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: What are you waiting for!? Shut it down!

dialogue.name: MECHANIC04031
dialogue.text: Y-Yes, my lord! Transmitting deactivation signal!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Ungh... It's not responding!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Ha...hahahaha! That insolent whelp had me worried for a moment!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Bring her to me alive, even if it means damaging the machine! When I am through with her, she will beg for death...

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: No...I can't let it end like this! Milisandia, Ricon, Rex, guide my hand!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Alfonse...wherever you are, lend me your strength!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
(-Synthetic Auracite System-)BZZZT... Combat sample...BZZZT...ready.
Initiating Overmind... Subject name: BZZZT...

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Overmind? What is that!?

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Aaaaaahhh!

dialogue.name: MECHANIC04031
dialogue.text: This can't be! It's ignoring the shutdown signal and initiating Overmind! But how!?

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: I don't care how! Stop that thing before it brings down the whole castrum!

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Why did Allie have to keep this all a secret? We could have helped her!

dialogue.name: AIRMAN04031
dialogue.text: Ready to depart? I'll send for Master Garlond.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We all expected another Weapon to appear sooner or later, but not quite like this.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: According to Valdeaulin, after it finished laying waste to the headquarters of the VIIth Legion, it took to the sky.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Though this has dealt a massive blow to the imperial forces, I am certain that Allie is on board the Weapon. It must be halted before she comes to harm, and for that, I need the G-Warrior and airships to transport it.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I see that one thing hasn't changed since your days as the Black Wolf: your penchant for gigantic warmachina.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: But if this means the G-Warrior has another chance to shine, I'd be happy to oblige. Only this time, rather than having it unceremoniously towed by airships, I have a more dynamic entrance in mind.

dialogue.name: AVILINA
dialogue.text: It's good to see you again, Forename.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: From what I hear, we have you to thank for Avilina volunteering to help the Ironworks. Since she joined the team, our work has come on leaps and bounds.

dialogue.name: AVILINA
dialogue.text: I'm just grateful for the opportunity to finally put my knowledge and skills to good use.

dialogue.name: AVILINA
dialogue.text: And as far as I can tell, your target is the Diamond Weapon, the most powerful of them all.

dialogue.name: AVILINA
dialogue.text: What's worse, its design incorporates all of the combat data and abilities of the other Weapons, making it far more formidable than those you encountered before.

dialogue.name: AVILINA
dialogue.text: Thankfully, we've had time to prepare for such an occasion.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Would you care to elaborate?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Let me put it like this...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Thanks to Avilina's tireless dedication, the G-Warrior has been reborn!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: But there'll be time to explain more on the way. Come on, the Enterprise is waiting.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Very impressive, but may I ask what purpose it serves?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Since our objective is to rescue the pilot, we've added a means of capturing the Diamond Weapon.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We come to save lives, not to end them, and for that reason, the G-Warrior has been reborn. I present to you the G-Savior!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I was unable to save Milisandia, Ricon, and Rex, but there may yet be hope for Allie and Alfonse...

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Were it not for you, I suspect Gaius would have ventured into Werlyt by himself, with little more than a gunblade for protection. Thank you for persuading him to take a less rash course of action.

dialogue.name: AIRMAN04031
dialogue.text: Ready to take to the skies?

dialogue.name: Q10
dialogue.text: Board the G-Savior?

dialogue.name: GSEMPLOYEE04031
dialogue.text: Master Garlond and the others are ready when you are!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Once again, Cid and his engineers have provided precisely what we require before we even knew it ourselves.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Due to the added complexity, we'll have Gaius pilot while Forename handles the various armaments.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Agreed.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: There will be little opportunity for us to grow accustomed to our roles, but even so, we must succeed at all costs.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I'll be monitoring the situation from the Enterprise. Should things take a turn for the worse, I'll be ready to intervene.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: While you and Gaius deal with the Diamond Weapon, I'll be doing my best to aid Valdeaulin's safe return from Werlyt. Hopefully, he's taken advantage of the chaos to make good his escape.

dialogue.name: AVILINA
dialogue.text: You're off to save Milisandia's foster siblings, Alfonse and Allie, aren't you? Please, do whatever you can to bring them back safely.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: It seems the controls are the same as the previous iteration. Though it has been some time since I last piloted warmachina of Allagan origin, lack of practice is no excuse for failure.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: We must reach the Diamond Weapon before the imperials.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: In all the years since the invasion, this place has hardly changed. I was expecting to find some sign of the VIIth Legion here, but it would appear the Diamond Weapon has already taken them out of the equation.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I pray we are not too late.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Allie!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Ah... Unnnh...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Please, take her back to Terncliff. I have some unfinished business to attend to...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Now to learn what has become of Alfonse.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: If you have a score to settle, now is your chance. Show yourself!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Come to gloat, have you, Gaius!? It's not over yet...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: You certainly have an instinct for self-preservation. I would expect nothing less from the coward who sacrificed his own soldiers to further his ambitions.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: How dare you speak to me of ambitions! You are the one who stood in my way at every turn!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: If not for your meddling, the Empire would've been mine! Mine!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Enough of your delusions of grandeur. Where is Alfonse?

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Heh...

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Hehehe...

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Ahahahahaha!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Why, he's right in front of you!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Once you hear the answer, you'll kick yourself for not realizing it sooner!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: You see, in all of the previous models, the combat data was either incomplete or unstable in some way, making their performance in battle wildly unpredictable. But then an idea struck me.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Rather than using data gathered in battle, I should use something a little more...realistic.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: It turns out that beloved boy of yours was quite brilliant...

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: ...when he put his mind to it!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: By my ingenuity, he has been reborn as the core of the greatest machine ever devised! None but the great Lord Valens van Varro could conceive such a marvel!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text:
Ahahahaha!
Aaahahahaha!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: And to think that Allie came here to steal the Diamond Weapon to save her brother, only to find he'd already become a part of it! Perhaps it wasn't the reunion she'd envisioned, but I'm sure she was grateful nonetheless!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Oh... That might also explain why Overmind activated all by itself. It was clearly an attempt to protect his precious sister! A fascinating anomaly, but I can't stand disobedience!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: That such atrocities should continue unabated is proof of the rot that has spread throughout the Empire.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Your crimes are an affront not only to Garlemald, but to all of mankind. And now...you will die.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Have you forgotten, Gaius? I've seen your data, I know your every move! Such pitiful swordsmanship is a relic of the past, just like you!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Terminus Est...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: ...Crocea Mors!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Gaaargh!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: B-But...this wasn't in...my data!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Overmind Alfonse-)Reactivating synthetic auracite system.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Th-This can't be...! How is it still functional!?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Overmind Alfonse-)Removing memory inhibitors...

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Hhhrrrngh!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: What!? Y-You!?

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Agh! Stop this at once...! Please! Let me go... Albert... No, Apharmd! W-Wait, no! No!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Even the names of those sacrificed in your twisted experiments are beneath your notice. You are beyond redemption.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Who are you to judge me, Gaius!? Do you remember the names of the tens of thousands of men, women, and children killed for the sake of your conquests?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I do not deny the blood spilled at my behest. Nor will I run from my past.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: That is why I fight. To prevent the wrongs I committed from being repeated.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: No... Stop, I beg you!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Y-You can't do this to me! I'm V-Valens van Varro! Better th-than Gaius, better than all of them!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: It c-can't end this way!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Aaannngh!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Alfonse?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Alfonse, my son... I have failed you.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: But this is not the end. I will see your dreams fulfilled. This I swear. I ask only that you, Milisandia, Ricon, and Rex watch over me.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: (-Overmind Alfonse-)Father... The memories stored in the Diamond Weapon... Give them to Allie...

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text:
(-Overmind Alfonse-)Watch over her...in my stead.
Father...I cannot go on like this... Please...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I understand.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Thank you. I am proud to call myself your son.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: ...I see. We will remain here until further notice.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: That was Gaius. Valens van Varro and the Weapon project are no more.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: Seizing the opportunity, the Werlyt Revolutionaries have taken control of the city. Though they still suffered considerable losses, they have at last gained their freedom.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: And even with the Empire gone, for people like me, life under imperial rule is all we've ever known. We might never be able to heal the scars left by decades of oppression.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: While there is hope for those who have survived this ordeal, nothing can bring back the dead. The loss of my wife and daughter left a void in me that can never be filled.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: In the years since, I have struggled to find a purpose, a reason to keep on living. It is the same for Gaius. No matter how hard he tries to make amends, the children he lost are gone forever.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: It's been some time since we last heard from Gaius.

obj.n: And Love You Shall Find Orchestrion Roll
